episode_title: 318 - The One With The Hypnosis Tape

content.description: Central Perk, all but Chandler are there, Joey laughs for no apparent reason.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s so funny?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, nothing, no. It’s an acting exercise, I’m practising my fake laugh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. (she laughs)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What-what’s so funny?
(Chandler enters with a cigarette.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh, no-no, no-no-no, there’s none of that in here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on man! At least let me finish this last one.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Okay, but only if you give me a drag.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(Chandler hands him the cigarette, and he takes a long drag.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Oh dark mother, once again I suckle at your smokey tit. (hands Chandler back the cigarette.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, why don’t you hang on to that one.
(He goes and sits down next to Rachel and puts a cigarette in his mouth, which Rachel takes away from him. He puts another cigarette in his mouth, and Rachel takes it away again.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, that’s like the least fun game ever.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’m really sick of your smoking, so I brought something that is going to help you quit. (hands him an audio cassette)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. (takes the cassette and puts it on his arm like the stop smoking patch, and it falls off.) Nope, that patch is no good. (Joey and Monica both do their fake laughs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, it’s a hypnosis tape. This woman at work used it for two weeks straight and she hasn’t smoked since.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pffhah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s your problem?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing, it’s just that hypnosis is beyond crap.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I watched you get hypnotised in Atlantic City.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, that guy did not hypnotise me! Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh right, ‘cause you always pull your pants down at the count of three and play Wipe-out on your butt cheeks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, y’know forget hypnosis. The way to quit smoking is you have to dance naked in a field of heather, and then bath in the sweat of six healthy young men.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Or what my Father called Thursday night.

content.description: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Ross is handing Rachel a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know what, I didn’t want cinnamon on this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry. (To remedy that, Ross scoops the cinnamon off of the top with his hand.)

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Frank! Hi!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, well y’know, I would’ve called but I lost your phone number and then ah, my Mom locked me out of the house so I couldn’t find it. And then, I tried to find a pay phone, and ah, the receiver was cut off. So…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Ah, oh, the ah, vandalism.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, also, what happened between you and your Mom?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, we got into a fight ‘cause ah, she said I was to immature to get married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your getting married?!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, yeah!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My little brother’s getting married!!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, I knew you’d be so cool about this. All right, ah, hey, do you want to meet her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do I?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Do you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I do, yeah.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Okay, cool, all right, she just ah, parking the truck. (to Joey) I’m gonna, I’m gonna get my ah, my fianc�e man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I would’ve bet good money that he’d be the first one of us to get married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, isn’t it fantastic?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, ah, but Pheebs don’t you think he’s a little young to get married?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, he’s 18.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Exactly, it’ll be illegal for him to drink at his own bachelor party.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, or-or to get a hooker.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Always illegal Joe.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey! Hey! This is ah, my fianc�e, Mrs. Knight. (he points out Phoebe to her)
content.parenthetical: entering with his fianc�e Alice, who is obviously much, much older than he is

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Y’know it-it’s funny, um, Frank told me so much about you, but your not how I pictured you at all.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I’m a big surprise.
(Ross lets them both sit in his chair.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, um, how-how did you guys meet?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well um, I was in ah Mrs. Knight’s ah, I mean Alice, sorry, Alice, I always do that. I was in her ah, Home Ec class.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: And he was my best student.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, she was my best teacher.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Ohhh. (They embrace in a very passionate kiss.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If that doesn’t keep kids in school, what will?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And so now you guys are gonna be married?

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Yeah. Y’know we-we talked about just living together, but um, we want to have kids right away.
(Both Chandler and Phoebe have shocked looks on their faces.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!! Great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, kids. Frank, are you sure you’re ready for that?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I mean, how hard can it be? Y’know, I mean, y’know, babies, y’know who doesn’t want babies right? And besides y’know, I never had a Dad around, and ah, now-now I always will, ‘cause y’know, it’ll be me. Right?

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Y’know, I mean, really we do realise that there’s an age difference between us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good! Okay. ‘Cause you were acting like you didn’t.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Oh no, but when it comes to love, what does age matter?
(They both growl and hiss at each other and then kiss passionately again.)

content.description: Chandler’s bedroom, Chandler is listening to the hypnosis tape.

content.speaker: Hypnosis Tape
content.text: You are falling fast asleep. Deeper. Deeper. Deeper. You are now completely asleep. You don’t need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman.

content.description: The Moondance Diner, Monica is working, Rachel is having lunch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And y’know what, I just realised, in the last year I’ve only gone out with two guys, Richard and Julio. You gotta help me out here, you gotta set me up, you gotta get me back in the game.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, that shouldn’t be a problem. I mean I work in fashion and all I meet are eligible straight men.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pete, can I get you something else?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Yeah, a slice of cheesecake and-and a date if you’re given’ ‘em out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Haven’t you and I covered that topic?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hmm, come on, you just said to her that you…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig, and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well, if that were true, I’d dating my Aunt Ruth. And the two times we went out were just plain awkward. (to Rachel) Come on, you think she should go out with me, don’t you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I mean, are you sure you want to go out with her? I mean that ain’t a pretty picture in the morning, y’know what I mean. That wig all in disarray, and boobs flung over the night stand, y’know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean really, think about it.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Ho-ho, I will.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Joey are being lectured by Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I know, I know, that this is Frank’s life, (walks behind them, they turn around in the leather chairs to face her) y’know. Y’know, I don’t want to be all judgmental, y’know, but this is sick, it’s sick and wrong!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, what, is it the age thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no, oh, I’m fine with the age thing y’know, until it starts sticking it’s tongue down my little brother’s throat!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, he seems to enjoy it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, I mean, do you think he’s gonna enjoy it when he’s up to his elbows in the diapers from all the babies they have to have right away?! This is not fair to Frank, (she walks behind them again, and hey again turn to follow her) and it-it’s not fair to the babies, and y’know what, it’s not good home economics.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, have-have you told him how you feel?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Not out loud.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, if you don’t tell him, soon he’s gonna be married, and then you’re gonna hate yourself.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but if I do tell him, then he’s gonna hate myself. I mean look at him and his Mom, I can’t. (pause) But, you guys can, please you gotta talk him out of it.

content.speaker: Ross and Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no. (They start to turn away, but Phoebe stops them, and turns them back to face her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, you guys, you have nothing to lose, I have everything to lose. Do you want me to lose everything? Everything?!

content.speaker: Ross and Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna go get Frank. (exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, we’re walking down the street and I turn to you and I say, “Hey, let’s go hang out at Totally Nude Nudes,” remember? And then, and then, you turn to me and say, “Nah, let’s just hang out at your place.” Well, that was a nice move dumb ass.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Monica are entering.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think you should definitely go out with this guy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nah, he doesn’t do anything for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, last Saturday night, what happened on Walker: Texas Ranger ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, umm, Walker was looking for this big bus load of kids… (realises) All right, I get your point.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I forgot the combination to this about a year ago? I just carry it around. Do you have any Chap Stick?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, how are those tapes working out for ya?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, pretty good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good! I haven’t smoked yet today, I feel great, and-and-and confident, that is a stunning blouse.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Mon, let’s give Pete a chance Come on, he was funny, he seems really nice, and that check thing was adorable.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What check thing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: As a joke, this customer at work who has a crush on me gave me a $20,000 tip. His number is on the check, he just did so I’d call him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pete Becker. Pete… (quickly grabs a magazine and opens it up to show her a picture) (pointing to the picture) Is this him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Bill Clinton.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who’s he huggin’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! That’s Pete! But why is Bill huggin’ Pete?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This guy invented Moss 865! Every office in the world uses that program!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We use it!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There you go!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Monica’s gonna go out with a millionaire.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not gonna go out with him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, I can’t believe this is a real $20,000 check, oh this is just so exciting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or incredibly offensive.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, sure, that too.
(Chandler is putting on the Chap Stick the same way that women put on lipstick, including the bit with the piece of tissue.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?
content.parenthetical: to the girls who are staring at him

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Joey are talking to Frank.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All we’re saying is don’t rush into anything.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, come on, think about it. You’re 18, okay, she’s 44, when you’re 36, she’s gonna be 88.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: What, you don’t think I know that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, the point is, there’s a lot of women out there you haven’t even had sex with yet!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, he-he’s right, he’s right. This is your time y’know, yeah, you’re young, you’re-you’re weird, chicks dig that.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Okay, but isn’t sex better when it’s with one person that you really, really care about.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, in a poem maybe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No the man’s right, that’s what I had with Rachel.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: You don’t have it anymore?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I ah, I slept with someone else.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Okay, so wait, all right, so how does that make things better?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It didn’t.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Okay, so what you used to have with Rachel, is what I’ve got with Alice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, wh-what, what is that like?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: It’s so cool man, it’s so, it’s just ‘cause being with her is so much better than like not being with her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why can’t I find that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t ask me, I had it and I blew it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I want it!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: You can have it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, maybe I can’t. I mean, maybe there’s something wrong with me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no! No!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: It’s out there man! I’ve seen it! I got it!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then you hold on to it!!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: All right, man!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, congratulations you lucky bastard! (hugs him)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, it’s after Ross and Joey’s talk with Frank, and Phoebe’s is finding out what happened.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re Frank’s best man?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I couldn’t help it, there love is so pure.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well then, (to Ross) what about you?! Huh?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m the ring bearer.

(As Phoebe stands there in shock and disbelief, Chandler comes out of the bathroom and walks to his bedroom. He’s just got out of the shower and has the towel wrapped around himself high across his chest, and another towel wrapped around his head, like women wear towels. Joey watches Chandler wondering what the hell he’s doing.)

content.description: Phoebe’s, Phoebe is opening the door.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! Oh, Alice, hi! Thanks. I’m so glad you could come, ‘cause I’ve got a real umm, Home Ec emergency. (Points to the table cloth, which has a huge mustard stain on it.)

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Oh my God, who died on this?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know. It’s a real mustard-tastrophe. Can you help me?

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Absolutely. Okay, first we’ll start with a little club soda and salt, and then if that doesn’t work we can go back to…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what, forget it. It’s ruined.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Oh no-no, never say that. If we can’t get it out then we can cut around the stain, add a little lace, you make a stylish throw.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or instead, maybe you could just not marry my brother Frank.

content.description: Pete’s office, he is participating in a conference call with three other employees, each of whom are on a different TV screen that he controls with a remote.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Okay, that’s great, but can we make it smaller? Can we make it fit on the head of a pin? I love when we make things fit on the head of a pin.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Got it. Yeah all right. Yeah, okay.
(The intercom buzzes.)

content.speaker: Secretary
content.text: You have a Miss Monica Geller here.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Uh, absolutely, yeah, send her in. (Monica enters) Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What the hell is this? (holding up the check)

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hang on a second. (to the employees) I’ll-I’ll talk to you in the morning. (turns two of the three off) I’m sorry what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Seriously, what is this supposed to mean?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Well, y’know, I never know how much to tip.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re supposed to double the tax. Not double the tax of Romania. I mean, what’s-what’s the deal? Are you, are you trying to buy me? Is this the way you get girls to go out with you?

content.speaker: Employee
content.text: Umm, I’m still here.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: You’re taking this all wrong. Because, if I didn’t leave you that tip, you wouldn’t of come down here, we wouldn’t be having this argument, and there wouldn’t be this ah, heat between us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Come on, you gotta admit that our relationship is ah, is hitting a new level now. ‘Cause you used to be like the chef, and I was the customer, and now we’re like this-this couple that fights.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, umm, you’re a loon.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Look, forget the check, okay. (rips up the check) I like you. I think you’re great. Come on, what do you say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Cause I don’t want to encourage this kind of behaviour.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: One meal! That’s all I’m asking for. Please? We go out, we eat, and if you don’t have a good time, I give you ten grand, we call it even.

content.description: Phoebe’s, she is coming home. She turns on the lights, and sits down on the couch.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hi. (She jumps up screaming.) Wait, no! Just put the mail down. It’s-it’s me!
content.parenthetical: hiding under a pile of clothes

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Whoa, sorry. Why were you just like all in the dark?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh well, um, your, your laundry just smelled so good, that I thought I’d curl up in it. Is that all right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, sure. So, how was your day?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, well just probably the worst one since I’ve been alive.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What umm, what happened?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Umm, Alice ah, she ah, called it off.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no. Did umm, did she say why?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Uh, no, not really, just that I was too young, y’know, but I don’t see how I could all of the sudden be too young, ‘cause I’m older than I was when we first got together.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah, no, I don’t, I don’t know. But, y’know what, maybe it’s just all for the best?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, if the best is like unbelievable pain!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, sweetie, oh. (hugs him)

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Y’know, I just was finally happy y’know. For the first time in my life! After my Dad left me, and then, and then getting arrested for stealing those birds, and then, and then the whole punctured lung thing! I can, it’s still really hard to take deep breaths in cold weather, but with Alice all that stuff kinda went away. And now it’s, and now it’s gone and I don’t know why!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, well I can tell you why. It’s, it’s because of me. But, y’know what, I only did it because I love you. Okay?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, well I, I kinda had a little chat with Alice, and I sort of made her see why you two shouldn’t be together, y’know. And you’re gonna see it to, one day, you really, really will.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Wait a minute, wait, this is because of you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, you, wait no, my Mother didn’t want us to be together, but the worst thing she ever did was tie me to the porch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, but.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Wait, y’know what, I-I came to you because I thought you’d understand! Oh no!! Y’know, I would storm out of here right now if-if I had some money, or a place to go…

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is getting Monica ready for her date. The guys are also there. The door buzzes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! The millionaire’s here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! (and he jumps all around)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, please, I’m just gonna have dinner with him. Okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, just because he buys you dinner, does not mean you owe him anything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, then get the lobster!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: (to Pete) Hey!

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!
(They’re all staring at him, with big, huge smiles on their faces.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how much cash do you got in your pocket right now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And that’s why, I’m not inviting you in for a drink. (starts to leave) Bye.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh-no-no-no-no…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just one drink?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, where do you want to go?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Hey, you like pizza?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s sounds great.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: I know a great little place.
[Cut to a shot of the coliseum in Rome, Italy.]

content.description: A restaurant in Rome, Monica is paying for the pizza.

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: You’re, hey, you’re not paying for the pizza!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh come on, it’s only fair, you paid for the flight. Now is, is that enough lire?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: Ahh, I’d throw another thousand on that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why, how much is that?

content.speaker: Pete
content.text: That’s about 60 cents.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, it’s the middle of the night. Joey is walking into the living room, and runs into the entertainment centre.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Every night!!
(He starts to walk to the bathroom and hears the hypnosis tape from Chandler’s bedroom.)

content.speaker: Hypnosis Tape
content.text: You do not need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. (Joey walks out smiling to himself.)

content.description: Phoebe’s, Frank is watching TV, and he’s very depressed as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Frank. Look, okay, I know that you think I did like this totally evil thing, but I so didn’t. There’s someone here who can explain this better than I can.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Hi Frank.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hi, Mrs. Knight.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Phoebe’s right Frank. I know it’s hard to hear, but it would’ve been wrong to go through with it. I-I-I was being selfish, even though we, we want the same things now, in the future we may not. (to Phoebe) Is that it, is that what it is?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but not just that.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Right, not just that. Umm, even though we love each other as much as we do, none the less…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: None the less.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: None the less. Umm, you’re too young to, to really know what you want. (They embrace in a passionate kiss.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s right, exactly. (sees them) All right, it’s a good bye kiss, that’s good. (Frank picks Alice up and they move to the couch) Bye-bye. (They both lie down on the couch and start to make out.) Okay, no, the important thing is that you see what I’m saying, y’know, just y’know, this is clearly wrong. (They ignore her) Okay, I’ve decided I’m gonna let this happen! Okay, can I just get my purse? (She reaches in and Alice moans) Okay, all right, good. (leaves).

content.description: Chandler’s bedroom, he’s listening to the hypnosis tape again.

content.speaker: Hypnosis Tape
content.text: Cigarette’s don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey’s your best friend. You want to make him a cheese sandwich everyday. (he laughs) And you also want to buy him hundreds of dollars worth of pants.
content.parenthetical: He’s recorded his voice on the tape

content.text: (Chandler wakes up and stares at the tape.)
